Text:
𝐓𝐎𝐃𝐀𝐘|| 𝐵𝐴𝐺𝑈𝐼𝑂’𝑆 𝐹𝐼𝑁𝐸𝑆𝑇 𝐴𝑊𝐴𝑅𝐷𝐸𝐷 𝐷𝑈𝑅𝐼𝑁𝐺 𝐹𝐿𝐴𝐺 𝑅𝐴𝐼𝑆𝐼𝑁𝐺 𝐶𝐸𝑅𝐸𝑀𝑂𝑁𝑌
During the Flag Raising Ceremony at the Baguio City Hall Grounds, the Local Government Unit of Baguio awarded certificates of appreciation to the BAGUIO’s FINEST in appreciation of their generous contributions and support during the cleanup operation at the Maharlika Livelihood Center.
The Maharlika Livelihood Center experienced a fire in the early hours of July 16, 2024. Due to the concerted efforts of government units and the community, the center was able to recover swiftly and resume operations within a few days following the incident.
The BCPO City Community Affairs and Development Unit, Police Stations 1-10, and City Mobile Force Company were honored during the ceremony for their dedicated service. The BAGUIO’s FINEST will remain committed to working with the community in the face of crisis, ensuring continuous safety and support even during challenging times.
#ToServeAndProtect 
#MahusayMatatagAtMaaasahanNaKapulisan 
#SaBagongPilipinasAngGustoNgPulisLigtasKa

𝘽𝙖𝙜𝙪𝙞𝙤'𝙨 𝘽𝙧𝙖𝙫𝙚𝙨𝙩 𝙝𝙤𝙨𝙩𝙚𝙙 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙁𝙡𝙖𝙜 𝙍𝙖𝙞𝙨𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝘾𝙚𝙧𝙚𝙢𝙤𝙣𝙮
𝙄𝙣 𝙋𝙝𝙤𝙩𝙤𝙨: 𝑩𝒂𝒈𝒖𝒊𝒐 𝑪𝒊𝒕𝒚 𝑭𝒊𝒓𝒆 𝑺𝒕𝒂𝒕𝒊𝒐𝒏 with the direct supervision of the City Fire Marshal, 𝑭𝑺𝑼𝑷𝑻 𝑴𝑨𝑹𝑰𝑺𝑶𝑳 𝑯𝑬𝑹𝑵𝑨𝑵𝑫𝑬𝒁 𝑶𝑫𝑰𝑽𝑬𝑹, personnel of this station hosted the Monday Traditional Flag Raising Ceremony at the City Hall Grounds, today August 5, 2024. 
-𝘽𝙖𝙜𝙪𝙞𝙤'𝙨 𝘽𝙧𝙖𝙫𝙚𝙨𝙩

FIRE AT BRGY. ANDRES BONIFACIO 
Baguio firefighters respond to a fire that hit a warehouse at Barangay Andres Bonifacio around 4 am today. 
Chief Operations SFO4 Tado Pakilo said that fire is now under control and firefighters and volunteers are now conducting a mop-up to reduce leftover smoke. -MTE 
Mileyvonne Tiamzon/BCFS

TOKEN OF GRATITUDE
The Baguio Fire Station and the local government commend the individuals and groups that assisted in the suppression of the fire at the Maharllika Livelihood Center and the subsequent cleanup activities that transpired in the affected stalls in the said structure.
